import Mathlib

/-!
Let (X, â€–Â·â€–_X) and (Y, â€–Â·â€–_Y) be normed vector spaces over a nontrivial normed field ð•œ.
If A : X â†’â‚—[ð•œ] Y is linear and bounded (i.e. there exists C â‰¥ 0 with â€–A xâ€– â‰¤ C â€–xâ€– for all x),
then A (viewed as a function) is continuous.
-/

theorem linear_map_bounded_implies_continuous {ð•œ : Type*} [NontriviallyNormedField ð•œ]
  {X : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup X] [NormedSpace ð•œ X]
  {Y : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup Y] [NormedSpace ð•œ Y]
  (A : X â†’â‚—[ð•œ] Y)
  (h : âˆƒ C : â„, 0 â‰¤ C âˆ§ âˆ€ x, âˆ¥A xâˆ¥ â‰¤ C * âˆ¥xâˆ¥) :
  Continuous (A : X â†’ Y) := by sorry
